name: Gotham Cathedral
description: A gothic cathedral in Gotham City, notable for its climactic battle between Batman and The Joker.

content.title: History
content.body: Gotham Cathedral is a massive gothic-style cathedral located in the heart of Gotham City. It is an iconic structure known for its towering spire and intricate architectural details. Throughout the years, it has been a central place for both religious gatherings and public events, symbolizing the architectural grandeur of Gotham.

content.title: Geography
content.body: Situated in the central district of Gotham City, Gotham Cathedral towers over many of the surrounding buildings, making it a prominent landmark. Its architectural style is inspired by classic Gothic elements, with pointed arches, ribbed vaults, and flying buttresses.

content.title: Notable Features
content.body:
- **Towering Spire**: The spire is one of the highest points in Gotham City, offering a breathtaking view of the cityscape.
- **Stained Glass Windows**: The cathedral is adorned with beautiful stained glass windows depicting various religious and historical scenes.
- **Belfry**: Houses large church bells that can be heard throughout the city.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: Gotham Cathedral is crucial to the climax of *Batman (1989)*. It is the setting for the final battle between Batman and The Joker. The Joker ascends to the top of the cathedral, where he summons a helicopter for escape, leading to a dramatic confrontation with Batman. This location highlights the tension and ultimate resolution of the film's conflict.
